com.uttt.common

Class Foreachable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.uttt.common.Foreachable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer>

    public final class Foreachable
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer>
    The Foreachable class is designed to simplify the abstraction of looping across a range of int values. Rather than loop controls like: 
     for(final int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {...}
    you can write them as: 
     for(final int i : Foreachable.until(size)) {...}
    Further, there are several variations of such factory methods which cover exclusive and inclusive upper bound, implicit zero vs. explicit lower bound, and implicit step-by-one vs. explicit step value.
